guide.introduction:
== How To Make High Quality Front Surface Mirrored Glass ==

I am going to teach you my preferred method of making front surface mirrors for SLR camera repairs, optics experimentation, laser optics, building high quality reflectors for controlling light in the studio and other useful applications. My process is simple and easy.
guide.introduction_rendered:
== How To Make High Quality Front Surface Mirrored Glass ==

I am going to teach you my preferred method of making front surface mirrors for SLR camera repairs, optics experimentation, laser optics, building high quality reflectors for controlling light in the studio and other useful applications. My process is simple and easy.

Tools
  • A container of paint stripper
  • A conventional back surface mirror
  • A few standard business cards or other thin cardboard stock
  • A gallon of distilled water
  • A soft brush to spread the stripper
  • A spray bottle filled with soapy, distilled water
  • A spray bottle filled with warm distilled water
  • Cotton balls
  • Methanol Alcohol (optional, see Text)
  • Pure Acetone (optional, see text)
  • Several plastic tubs for holding materials and cleaning glass
  • Soap or detergent. I suggest Green Soap from the drugstore. This soap is very mild, it does not contain any fragrances and it is non-abrasive
  • Some newspapers, stripper resistant gloves and eye protection to protect both the work surface and the worker

lines.text: First, manufacturers carefully clean the glass. The glass must be scrupulously clean or the glass silvering process will fail. These days, manufacturers employ highly automated equipment to produce miles of mirrored glass every day.
lines.text_raw: First, manufacturers carefully clean the glass. The glass must be scrupulously clean or the glass silvering process will fail. These days, manufacturers employ highly automated equipment to produce miles of mirrored glass every day.

lines.text: After cleaning, the glass is chemically tinned. This simply means manufacturers treat the glass with chemicals containing tin compounds.
lines.text_raw: After cleaning, the glass is chemically tinned. This simply means manufacturers treat the glass with chemicals containing tin compounds.

lines.text: After tinning, manufacturers apply various solutions containing silver nitrate and other chemicals. A chemical reaction with the tin will force the silver out of solution where it firmly adheres to the glass, thus creating a mirror.
lines.text_raw: After tinning, manufacturers apply various solutions containing silver nitrate and other chemicals. A chemical reaction with the tin will force the silver out of solution where it firmly adheres to the glass, thus creating a mirror.

lines.text: Some manufacturers will also chemically apply a copper layer over the silver layer which helps further protect the mirror.
lines.text_raw: Some manufacturers will also chemically apply a copper layer over the silver layer which helps further protect the mirror.

lines.text: Pure silver provides the reflective surface for almost every mirror manufactured today. By the way, you will probably not get rich reclaiming the silver from old mirrors. The coating is exceedingly thin and the cost of recovery can exceed the value of the recovered metal.
lines.text_raw: Pure silver provides the reflective surface for almost every mirror manufactured today. By the way, you will probably not get rich reclaiming the silver from old mirrors. The coating is exceedingly thin and the cost of recovery can exceed the value of the recovered metal.

lines.text: The final step is to apply a painted backing to protect the mirror from tarnish and scratches.
lines.text_raw: The final step is to apply a painted backing to protect the mirror from tarnish and scratches.

lines.text: Are you beginning to see where this is going? I am going to show you how to remove the painted backing and copper layer from a standard back surface mirror, thus converting the mirror into a front surface mirror.
lines.text_raw: Are you beginning to see where this is going? I am going to show you how to remove the painted backing and copper layer from a standard back surface mirror, thus converting the mirror into a front surface mirror.

lines.text: I use three plastic tubs (from the local Dollar Store) when I make mirrors. You really do not need to use three tubs if you do not want to. This is simply how I prefer to work. I use one tub to hold the glass for stripping, a tub of soapy water for my first cleaning and a tub filled with distilled water for final rinsing.
lines.text_raw: I use three plastic tubs (from the local Dollar Store) when I make mirrors. You really do not need to use three tubs if you do not want to. This is simply how I prefer to work. I use one tub to hold the glass for stripping, a tub of soapy water for my first cleaning and a tub filled with distilled water for final rinsing.

lines.text: If you want to use methanol alcohol to speed up drying, make sure the container you use is alcohol resistant. Alcohol aids the drying process and reduces water spots.
lines.text_raw: If you want to use methanol alcohol to speed up drying, make sure the container you use is alcohol resistant. Alcohol aids the drying process and reduces water spots.

lines.text: If you use the immersion cleaning technique at the end of the article, you will need an acetone resistant container as well.
lines.text_raw: If you use the immersion cleaning technique at the end of the article, you will need an acetone resistant container as well.

lines.text: I also use spray bottles to remove the majority of the paint stripper before I place the glass into the cleaning and rinsing tubs. This reduces the amount of stripper transferred to the final cleaning tub, which produces a cleaner mirror.
lines.text_raw: I also use spray bottles to remove the majority of the paint stripper before I place the glass into the cleaning and rinsing tubs. This reduces the amount of stripper transferred to the final cleaning tub, which produces a cleaner mirror.

lines.text: Before you begin, make sure that you read and understand any safety information and handling instructions provided by the manufacturer. Paint strippers are quite caustic, so handle paint stripper with care.
lines.text_raw: Before you begin, make sure that you read and understand any safety information and handling instructions provided by the manufacturer. Paint strippers are quite caustic, so handle paint stripper with care.

lines.text: I have tried a variety of commercial paint strippers and they all work well in this application. I like automotive paint stripper in an aerosol can, but I also use non-aerosol strippers if they are on sale at the local Home Center.
lines.text_raw: I have tried a variety of commercial paint strippers and they all work well in this application. I like automotive paint stripper in an aerosol can, but I also use non-aerosol strippers if they are on sale at the local Home Center.

lines.text: Before you begin, prepare your work surface. I use newspapers, but anything that can protect your work surface from the action of the stripper is fine.
lines.text_raw: Before you begin, prepare your work surface. I use newspapers, but anything that can protect your work surface from the action of the stripper is fine.

lines.text: I usually place the mirror in a plastic tub lined with newspaper. This makes clean up a snap. I might suggest that before you begin, mix a little detergent and warm distilled water and fill a cheap plastic tub. This will be your primary rinse station.
lines.text_raw: I usually place the mirror in a plastic tub lined with newspaper. This makes clean up a snap. I might suggest that before you begin, mix a little detergent and warm distilled water and fill a cheap plastic tub. This will be your primary rinse station.

lines.text: Stripper Application Place the mirrored glass on your work surface liberally coat the painted backing with paint stripper. Make sure you cover the entire painted backing with stripper. Once you apply the stripper, wait for the reaction to start.
lines.text_raw: Stripper Application Place the mirrored glass on your work surface liberally coat the painted backing with paint stripper. Make sure you cover the entire painted backing with stripper. Once you apply the stripper, wait for the reaction to start.

lines.text: At first, nothing will appear to happen. Then all of a sudden, the painted backing will bubble and crack and the painted layer will puff up. The reaction happens rapidly, leaving you with a uniform crackled appearance.
lines.text_raw: At first, nothing will appear to happen. Then all of a sudden, the painted backing will bubble and crack and the painted layer will puff up. The reaction happens rapidly, leaving you with a uniform crackled appearance.

lines.text: Carefully slip the corner of a business card between the painted layer and the mirrored glass and lift the painted backing layer free from the mirror. In most cases, you can lift the entire painted backing free, leaving almost no residue remaining on the silver coating.
lines.text_raw: Carefully slip the corner of a business card between the painted layer and the mirrored glass and lift the painted backing layer free from the mirror. In most cases, you can lift the entire painted backing free, leaving almost no residue remaining on the silver coating.

lines.text: Spray the glass liberally using your detergent and water filled spray bottle. The goal is to remove the majority of paint stripper before you place the glass in the first cleaning tub. Spray the edges, the front and back of the glass.
lines.text_raw: Spray the glass liberally using your detergent and water filled spray bottle. The goal is to remove the majority of paint stripper before you place the glass in the first cleaning tub. Spray the edges, the front and back of the glass.

lines.text: Next, place the mirror into the tub of soapy water, and carefully remove any residual stripper from the glass using a few cotton balls.  When you clean the mirrored layer, be very careful. The silver layer is exceedingly thin. In fact, if you hold the stripped glass up to the light, the glass will have a smoky appearance. This “smoke” is the silver layer that forms the mirror.
lines.text_raw: Next, place the mirror into the tub of soapy water, and carefully remove any residual stripper from the glass using a few cotton balls.  When you clean the mirrored layer, be very careful. The silver layer is exceedingly thin. In fact, if you hold the stripped glass up to the light, the glass will have a smoky appearance. This “smoke” is the silver layer that forms the mirror.

lines.text: Always work under water to avoid scratches. Use a light touch and do not scrub the mirrored coating. Do not worry if you see fine scratches. They will not (generally) cause a problem unless they are big. You can tell if scratches will be a problem by looking at the front of the mirror after it is clean and dry.
lines.text_raw: Always work under water to avoid scratches. Use a light touch and do not scrub the mirrored coating. Do not worry if you see fine scratches. They will not (generally) cause a problem unless they are big. You can tell if scratches will be a problem by looking at the front of the mirror after it is clean and dry.

lines.text: Place the mirror against a black background and look at the surface of the coating. In most cases, you should not see too many scratches.
lines.text_raw: Place the mirror against a black background and look at the surface of the coating. In most cases, you should not see too many scratches.

lines.text: I restore old cameras and finding replacement reflex mirrors can be difficult. Therefore, I make replacements from ordinary back surface mirrored glass. I have noticed scratches from time to time, but I usually ignore them because they seldom cause me any serious problems.
lines.text_raw: I restore old cameras and finding replacement reflex mirrors can be difficult. Therefore, I make replacements from ordinary back surface mirrored glass. I have noticed scratches from time to time, but I usually ignore them because they seldom cause me any serious problems.

lines.text: By the way, perfect mirrors might not be strictly required in your particular applications, so do not become frustrated in the mirror you make is not flawless because it might not matter.
lines.text_raw: By the way, perfect mirrors might not be strictly required in your particular applications, so do not become frustrated in the mirror you make is not flawless because it might not matter.

lines.text: Also, understand that smaller mirrors are easier to prepare, so do not strip a large mirror if you only need a small mirror.
lines.text_raw: Also, understand that smaller mirrors are easier to prepare, so do not strip a large mirror if you only need a small mirror.

lines.text: If you see traces of the copper layer, you can remove it using a cotton ball and a very light touch during the cleaning stage. I use mirrored wall ties for my mirror source and I seldom see the copper layer; it comes off with the stripper.
lines.text_raw: If you see traces of the copper layer, you can remove it using a cotton ball and a very light touch during the cleaning stage. I use mirrored wall ties for my mirror source and I seldom see the copper layer; it comes off with the stripper.

lines.text: After cleaning, place the glass in a tub of distilled water and carefully agitate the glass. Agitate for at least 30 seconds, then lift the glass and let it drain.
lines.text_raw: After cleaning, place the glass in a tub of distilled water and carefully agitate the glass. Agitate for at least 30 seconds, then lift the glass and let it drain.

lines.text: Now, place the glass into a container of methanol alcohol and agitate for at least 15 seconds. Lift the mirror and let it drain. The alcohol will help the drying process and greatly reduce the tendency for water spots to form.
lines.text_raw: Now, place the glass into a container of methanol alcohol and agitate for at least 15 seconds. Lift the mirror and let it drain. The alcohol will help the drying process and greatly reduce the tendency for water spots to form.

lines.text: Methanol is also part of the immersion cleaning process described later.
lines.text_raw: Methanol is also part of the immersion cleaning process described later.

lines.text: Finally, inspect your mirror for obvious issues and problems. Should you find a serious flaw, simply make another mirror.
lines.text_raw: Finally, inspect your mirror for obvious issues and problems. Should you find a serious flaw, simply make another mirror.

lines.text: Immersion Cleaning Technique You can clean smaller mirrors using a variety of techniques. The Immersion Cleaning Technique is the best technique I have found for cleaning delicate optical surfaces.
lines.text_raw: Immersion Cleaning Technique You can clean smaller mirrors using a variety of techniques. The Immersion Cleaning Technique is the best technique I have found for cleaning delicate optical surfaces.

lines.text: 1. Place some lens cleaning tissue in the bottom of a small dish. I prefer glass. Make sure the dish is large enough to hold the mirrored glass 2. Fill the dish with methanol alcohol and place your mirror in this dish. Carefully wipe (while immersed) the silver surface using cotton balls. After you wipe down the mirror, agitate the dish for fifteen seconds 3. Remove the mirror and allow it to drain for a few moments and repeat the above steps using Acetone rather than Methanol Alcohol 4. Finally, remove the mirror from the Acetone, let it drain for a few moments and blow it dry.

lines.text: When it comes to selecting glass mirrors to be converted, I have a definite preference for mirrored wall tiles from the local Home Center. I prefer mirror tiles because they strip cleanly and I encounter very few problems like scratches. They are single strength glass and that makes them easy to cut.
lines.text_raw: When it comes to selecting glass mirrors to be converted, I have a definite preference for mirrored wall tiles from the local Home Center. I prefer mirror tiles because they strip cleanly and I encounter very few problems like scratches. They are single strength glass and that makes them easy to cut.

lines.text: For smaller pre-cut mirrors, a visit to your local craft store is a good place to start. You can find many different mirror shapes and sizes. In addition, pre-cut craft mirrors seem to suffer fewer problems like scratches.
lines.text_raw: For smaller pre-cut mirrors, a visit to your local craft store is a good place to start. You can find many different mirror shapes and sizes. In addition, pre-cut craft mirrors seem to suffer fewer problems like scratches.

lines.text: This process is suitable for most of your mirror making needs. The benefit this process provides is you will always have a ready source of front surface mirrors whenever you need them.
